body_html:
Hi!

Would after_create_session() work for something that you want to run only once?

What are those "auxiliary session.run() calls" that you are talking about? The relevant queues that I can think of are given the raw session that doesn't run hooks.
body_text:
Hi!
Would after_create_session() work for something that you want to run only once?
What are those "auxiliary session.run() calls" that you are talking about?  The relevant queues that I can think of are given the raw session that doesn't run hooks.
body:
Hi!  

Would [after_create_session()](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.4/tensorflow/python/training/session_run_hook.py#L115) work for something that you want to run only once?

What are those "auxiliary session.run() calls" that you are talking about?  [The relevant queues that I can think of are given](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.4/tensorflow/python/training/monitored_session.py#L557) the raw session that doesn't run hooks.
